  • Description: Plastic jerricans with vented caps in oversized corrugated carton with bubble wrap filler. No hazard markings on exterior, despite hazard diamonds on inner jerricans. No hazmat paperwork or service code. Liquid leaked from vented caps, damaging carton.

item.title: Report E-2024080531
item.description:
Report E-2024080531

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-05
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 5, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3082 was damaged in a load shift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and terminal lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works (EW) to remediate the impacted site. EW personnel collected one (1) damaged 55-gallon drum of UN 3082 and containerized it in one (1) 95-gallon overpack. Crews then deployed granular absorbents and worked them in using hand tools. Once collected, EW personnel utilized absorbent wipes to remediate any residual product. All UN 3082 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 95-gallon overpack and one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024080453
item.description:
Report E-2024080453

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-21T15:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-05
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 5, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon jug of UN2014 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the site. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.
